intro: Sukana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and blue, making it a popular ornamental plant. Sukana thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
